div.p: Staatsbibliothek zu Berlin, Preussischer Kulturbesitz, Berlin.

By the Messageries maritimes Steamer "Australien", dear Prof Lacroix, I have sent you a very large piece of Nickel ore, adressed to the Musée d'histoire naturelle, and Mons Ailland of that steamer has kindly taken care of it
you will probably receive this magnificent specimen before this letter reaches you.

This large echantillon consists of Zaratite , Ni CO + 6H20 It came from S.W. Tasmania and is chemically different from Nickel-ores, seen by me from New Caledonia. So, I trust, it will be acceptable to your galleries. It weighs perhaps 60 lb or more.

Two small specimens of different minerals for you are enclosed in a box of zoologic specimens, sent to Prof. Milne Edwards simultaneously. Will you be so kind to adress some few lines of acknowledgment to Mons Ailland for his kindness of taking the heavy specimen to Marseilles and putting it on the railway for Paris
